item.title: Risk-adjusted Stock Return
item.description: Introduction The Sharpe Ratio is a way of evaluating the value of an investment after subtracting for its risk. In this project we’ll use it to compare four stocks: Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, and Tesla. We’ll be using the S&P 500 to measure the overall volatility of the market. Getting started To start, we’ll load in the data which was pulled from Yahoo Finance. To account for the recent recession the data begins with the start of the current business cycle in early March.
